This isn't a "Shanghai 1930ish, bring a date to listen to live jazz and eat overpriced quasi-asian food" kind of place.  This is more like a.. "long day at work, too lazy to get off the couch to cook, only have $8 dollars in my wallet and oooo some greasy chinese food takeout would hit the spot" kind of place.  They even deliver sometimes (if they're not too busy)... its kind of negotiable, order more food and they'll deliver.   The honey walnut prawns are really good.
author: M P.

description: I like this place because the lunch specials are like $5 for a huge amount of food. The Kung Pao chicken is some of the spiciest i've had in SF, and has a great, light crispy edge with lots of peanuts and zucchini, instad of the thick gooey stuff most places serve. Their Tso's and other stuff aren't really my cup of tea but other folks I go here with swear by it. Overall the food is avearge to good, and the service is usually decent although sometimes at lunch you can end up waiting a while if it's really busy.
author: andy c.

description: This is a great lunch place to eat or take out. Prices are good and food is tasty. The owner is always nice to me when taking my order and she always gives me extra fortune cookies for my daughter. For an easy non expensive chinese lunch I recommend this place.
author: Dawn B.

description:
My company orders from House of Hunan very regularly simply because it is close to our offices and offers free delivery.  The older gentleman who delivers the food is very sweet and good-natured and the nicest person there.  The woman who seems to run the place and most often answers the phone/takes the orders is rude, manner-less, unkind and incompetent.  

Some of the dishes are quite good, some are disgusting.  My first experience was a bad one: I ordered the breaded prawns, which I now call Cornprawns (instead of corndogs) because they were coated in an extremely thick and bad tasting breading and were completely inedible (stuck so thoroughly to the prawn that I couldn't even pick it off).  However, after that I discovered their Spicy Chicken and Mongolian Beef, two dishes that are tasty and even offer a healthy brown rice alternative!

The good and bad of the food being said, the woman who works the main desk has such a bad attitude and is so rude that they don't have a dish on the menu delicious enough to make it worth tolerating her.  Today she got my dish wrong and, while it is somewhat of a hassle, it happens and it's not the end of the world.  I simply asked for no vegetables.  I don't like them.  Enough said.  I called to ask her to please have the correct dish sent over (even though I had walked over to pick our $90+ order originally) and she repeated my entire order to me, including my dish as I had ordered it with no vegetables, and claimed that I must be in error since she wrote the order down correctly.  I said I wasn't doubting that she wrote the order down correctly but a disconnect occurred somewhere between her writing it down and it getting to my desk because it was sitting in front of me and was indeed completely wrong, covered in vegetables.  She continued to yell at me that I was wrong but finally, after about 10 minutes of this bullcrap, agreed to send over the correct dish.  

My new, replacement dish arrives about 20 minutes later -- exactly the same, covered in onions!!  I called her again to let her know and perhaps get some kind of credit for the dish and call it a wash.  She said, "Look, I am very busy."  Too busy to get my order right?  Too busy to be courteous?  Perhaps I should be too busy to pay next time!  She says, "I didn't even charge you for it!"   Well of course you didn't - why would I be charged for you to correct your error?!  Then she drops the humdinger, "It's just onions!"  I do believe I paid you $7.95 for a dish with NO VEGETABLES and not for you to decide what I should be eating and which vegetables I should like or dislike.  I was dumbfounded.  I just hung up.

I'll tell you what, I am too busy to ever give them my patronage again but I am not too busy to write this review and let everyone know that House of Hunan needs to fire that crazy jerk of a female working their front desk.
author: Robyn S.

description: O.K. I agree with Dr. M as far as the older woman being grumpy, but as an alpha-type I ain't letting someone under 100 lb scare me away from what is the best tofu lunch deal in the city. I was there the other day and the stern lady handed me a to-go box of not what I ordered --- I was at a table. Did I cower and accept it?! Not on your life! I got the only thing I want there: Kung Pao Veggies with Tofu & brown rice, $6.49 with tax, and it comes with soup and tea. What a deal.  But most importantly, you can be sure you ain't eating Kitty as Kristine J. insinuates (so many crude things come to mind it gives me writer's log-jam).
author: Andy Z.

description: I read the reviews and was prepared for the lady that works there that gets irritated and can be rude at times.  No problem with that, I called and ordered two entrees and rice, the food came quickly and was hot.  Problem is it was it was the worst Chinese food I've ever had in my life.  Just did not taste good - any of it.
author: Phillip K.

description: I am tempted to go back to convince myself that the food was really THAT bad... Well, I am not gonna try again, that's for sure, so don't come crying to me and say I recommended this place...
author: Dr K.

description: Sure its not gourmet or "california" chinese food, but it's reasonably priced and not as greasy as some people seem to think. I got the General's chicken which had a nice sauce and was heavily breaded. The chicken probably wasn't the best, however, you can't expect too much from this small establishment. It's a decent lunch spot and great takeout place for some quick, satisfying food...
author: Nicolas H.

description: delivery chinese food in south beach...salt and pepper pork chops were pretty decent...dry braised string beans with prawns was pretty good...i think it's a good idea to stick to the "chef's recommendations"....
author: Hen A.

description: I've only gotten take out from here, and each time I am pleasantly surprised. I believe this one is under new management (the old one was really terrible), but now its family run. The wife is the only one I ever see serving/taking orders. Not much of an eat in restaurant, I think most of their business is from deliveries. Had the chef's special minced seafood w/ lettuce cups and chicken w/ green beans, and I was very happy. Although.... their menu says no MSG... but i swear I got the jitters afterwards. Oh!! and as an added bonus, they now serve brown rice (they did not before)... so you can feel like you're actually eating healthy now ;)
author: Marina K.

description: It's a convenient price with regular quality... the place lacks of a good atmosphere too!
author: Alberto X.

description: Hmmm, I had my doubts and it was true. This place isn't good. I will likely try again. But the General Shao's chicken was like a spicy donut with a mini gem of a chicken hidden in the middle. The sauce was okay & the broccoli surprisingly steamed to perfection. The price was right at $4.95 - because all they served me was soup, 1 lb of rice, some dough with sauce and a fortune cookie. Do NOT try their tapioca drinks, the nice, smooth & delicious (ahem) tapioca balls that I love so are replaced by something that looks like MeatWad from ATHF. Ick!
author: Colleen B.

description: It's not bad for last minute takeout and it's close by and they do deliver for a $15 minimum order.  Boyfriend's complaint was that the sauces (eggplant and dried green beans) were on the sour side but personally I kind of liked it.  The salt and pepper pork chop was not bad and the portion was large.  Also ordered the half duck, probably wouldn't order it again.
author: Jen C.

description: The neighborhood Chinese restaurant. To go orders arrive more quickly if you wait for them at the bar. You can have a beer while you wait and read the gazillion magazines they have on the counter. Food delivery orders take FOREVER. Don't do it. The basic dishes are solid but some of their fish dishes are really quite good. They will substitute Gai-lon for American Broccoli if they have it and you ask them. Their noodle soups are good and their mango jelly drink is my favorite.
author: Sirima S.

description: Most people are pretty forgiving when it comes to Chinese restaurants. Places I think are completely disgusting as a Chinese person, are considered "dive wonders" to people who didn't grow up on Chinese food. Go figure that the reviews of House of Hunan are so poor! I was tired of eating Crossroads and South Beach Cafe every day since my office is right across the street. I finally ventured into this Chinese place after 8 months and was pleasantly surprised. The food was tasty and the service is fast. I tend to stick with the dishes with vegetables and simple preparation, since I know it's harder to get wrong. My staple is the black bean chicken. It comes with lots of veggies and good Cantonese style white rice. I would give this place a chance. It's the one Asian place among a sea of heavy food options in that part of SOMA.
author: Joanne W.

description:
These people are racist in this restaurant.

I went in to do a take out order, and placed my order.  After I ordered, three other people came in and did a take out order, and another couple came in and sat down.  The lady took all their orders.  Then she called out the order for one of the take outs that ordered after me.  Then another order for someone that ordered after me.  Then she served the seated couple their appetizers.  Then the third person that did the take out order was presented with their food.  Then she served the seated couple their entrees.  Where the hell was my food.  I was the first person that ordered, yet nothing.  I went and complained, the lady yelled something in Chinese, and she said we have a new cook.  WTF does that matter about whose food they prepared first.  She then yelled again into the kitchen (I suspect calling in my order) and then another 15 minutes later I got my food.  The common theme - all the people that were given their food before me were white or asian.  I am a dark skinned, so I was treated like the lowest man in society, and served last.  Amazing.  She never apologized or anything.

Avoid these RACIST people.  

To all Chinese food proprietors -- open a spot in SOMA by the ballpark, treat everyone equally, apologize if you made a mistake, and get rid of these people at House of Hunan.

And the food was lousy - the snow peas with mushrooms was doused in vinegar.
author: Dave A.

description: We just ordered chinese food from there tonight.  It was really good.  For quick take out on a night when you are exhausted from work it was great.  We ordered the pork potstickers, orange chicken, mongolian beef, fried pork won tons, and egg fried rice.  The sauces that accompany all the dishes were an A+.  Those kinds of sauces that you would drink cause they are so good.  I would not have ordered the bbq spare ribs again though.  They just didn't have much flavor, but other than that we will try House of Hunan again for sure.
author: Janae B.

description: Average Chinese food, with regular prices. Mom and pop style, which is good for the service, but not a lot of traffic, causing them to sometimes be closed without notice.
author: Jamieson S.

description: 2.5 stars for mediocre Americanized Chinese food.  The food here is not terrible, but I'm never excited when my coworkers want to come here for lunch.  It's not bad for the price, but it's not a great sign when I find myself wishing this place was a Panda Express instead.
author: Albert C.

description:
I tried this place because I was picking up a lunch order, and it's near my office.

In her defense, I think she may be an owner, but she's usually rude.  The last time (my co-workers, not me ordered) I was there, I think this woman at the counter was really trying to be kind.

Unfortunately, the service was slow----there weren't many people on the "off-time" I went in so that was odd.

However, I tried the food once, but was not impressed.  

Although, they have no MSG, so that's a good thing.

I hate to admit it, but I've tried better food in a shopping mall food court--and I detest malls and food courts!
author: Julie B.

description: love this place....i can walk their for lunch and for 7 bucks smile in delight as I eat in from of our big screen at work.  YUMMY...i always ger the Mongolian Beef with extra sauce...so grubbin!
author: Rachelle I.

description: Bleh - I only go hear because it's around the corner. Definitely in the market for a replacement.
author: Niki N.

description: House of Hunan is ridiculously bad.  I've actually never seen the place but have ordered delivery from there a couple times.  Unfortunately, it's one of the few Chinese restaurants in South Beach, and as far as I know the only one that delivers.  I've had the kung pao chicken, broccoli beef and wonton soup from there.  Everything was quite inedible.  Gotta find some other options.
author: Saw T.

description: I am a fan of the "prawns over rice with scrambled egg"...good dish...good prices for lunch..
author: Juliet W.

description: since it is not even a full block away from my residence at Bayside village, I frequent this place fairly often.  The usual order is bbq pork fried rice (very consistent, good amount of pork, not too greasy or salty), house special chow mein (again, very consistent, always get two shrimp, three piece of chicken and about 5 pieces of beef in the container) and either sesame or orange chicken (of the battered and deep fried variety).  It isn't great but definately isn't bad.  The service is prompt, but not very friendly.  I know that they have a high score on their health inspection card, which is always important for me at a chinese place.  I haven't been yet for dim sum, but a couple people have said it is fair.
author: Daniel M.

description:
the prices are good and the food is decent, but if you're ordering in, you'll probably going to have to wait for about an hour.  i'm not a big fan of fast food chinese, but my buddy always wants to order here when i visit b/c it's about 2 blocks away from her place.  i'd say they are over an hour late for 85% of the time.  the average wait is 40 minutes...so the lady at the restaurants always says.  

unfortunately, their driver is a very sweet, old chinese man and when he finally snails on in and knocks on the door, my hunger and rage quickly fades away when i see his gentle smile.  i give him an extra tip and wish him a good evening.  damn it.  foiled again.
author: Immer E.

description: The food is ok.  The service in this place is horrible.  Don't think about getting a to go order.  I had to wait over 40 minutes at least twice there after I ordered the food 20 minutes before that.  She needs to hire someone.
author: B A.

description: Hands down the worst Chinese food EVER.  That is honestly all I can say.  When I am craving some greasy, nasty Chinese food, I will pretty much eat anything.  I couldn't even eat this.  It was that bad.  The thought of it makes my skin crawl.  Gross.
author: Shelley M.

description:
a star for good service!
but if you dare venture, beware. no, really- it's flavorless...
author: katrine n.

description:
i agree the lady is rude and grumpy when it gets a little busy. I kinda understand it because i came from the same ethnic background. I think people should give the lady a break since shes there 7 days a week. 

I recently chatted with her and she complains about how her chefs couldn't get anything right, hence the yelling. She is just trying to sell herself with the food and service, not trying to impress the 21st century generation by being modest, socializing, and oh did i mention GAY! from what i've read on those hate reviews it seems like they want a angel behind the counter instead of someone that is trying to sell good food and maintain a business. Maybe this is the difference between hard labor and typing behind a screen! 

despite the gay reviews, i've talked to the lady and told her about wuts on yelp, and she said she has changed. except her use of english, i believe it could be scary to some people, but bare with her as she is trying really hard. 

Also, I've never heard from any of my co-workers nor other ppl on yelp mention about cockroaches. the person that claimed there were cockroaches probably is talking about his own kitchen, because ever since house of hunan been open they have a pest control inspection twice a month. 

plus who can not order delivery from House of Hunan when there is a kind little delivery man that rides a cute red bicycle. I swear this man is so nice and cute riding his bike down berry st, haha i always look out the window to check him out. he makes my day when he speaks with that accent, hehe.

so my favorite is still the salted fish fried rice, mongolian chicken, salt and pepper pork chops, asparagus prawns with black bean sauce, honey walnut prawns. I'm not too into their appetizers, but i heard they are trying to improve their fried prawns. So i will try that when they finalize the recipe, mmmm i cant wait to try new things.
author: GwunZi H.

description: I have eaten here multiple times and would say it's a decent place to get some not too greasy Chinese. May not be as "authentic" as some people want, but I have liked most things that I have ordered there. I haven't tried takeout, just pick up, and it's ready in less than 15 mins. I would recommend this place to someone living/working nearby that wanted a nice Chinese meal.
author: J M.

description:
I ate here the other day because it's a block from my new place.  I thought the food was pretty good.  I have yet to find a Chinese restaurant that has blown me away.  We usually order in, but this place is so close that there is no need (although I think we would have gotten our food quicker if we had it delivered).  The service wasn't perfect, but the poor lady running the place was so freakin' busy that I wouldn't have expected it to be.  There was only one other table occupied, but tons of people calling for delivery and no less than 3 people waiting for to-go orders.  It's a busy little place, give the lady a break.
We had lemon chicken, chicken chow mien, vegetable egg foo yung, bbq pork buns, fried bananas, and bbq short ribs (we like to order a lot and have tons of left overs).  Everything was decent.  My boyfriend ate there a few days earlier and had a completely different experience.  I think it just depends on what you order.  I didn't think the food was too greasy or over sauced at all.  The egg foo yung was a little funky in texture, but had great flavor.  The pork buns were fluffy and yummy--almost like a biscuit.  The chow mien was perfect--not too oily and great flavor.  Although, after reading the review about the cockroach I am a bit hesitant to go back, which totally sucks because they are so convenient .
author: Corina D.

description: Was looking for a takeout chinese restaurant and last night this place fit the bill.  Not too greasy, lots of fresh veg, large servings and affordable... definitely great chinese takeout.
author: SHANNON E.

description: anyone know why when i order asparagus with chicken i just get stalks, not tips? why won't they won't give me any asparagus tips? what do they do with the tips???
author: Al B.

description: it's in the hood, it's got easy parking in front, prices are ok. great for take out on nights when i'm too damn lazy to do anything else. but i wouldn't go out of my way if you're not in the area or craving chinese.
author: Elena N.

description: I have been to House of Hunan multiple times and each one has been a great experience!   They have great hot and sour soup, sesame chicken, sweet & sour chicken, fried wontons, general tso's chicken!  Everything I have tried has been great!  The service was speedy.  I've read some reviews about the woman who is always there not being the most friendly, I could see how that could be true, I just think she is to the point, she has never been rude or trying to rush me.  She's just all business.  I would recommend this for take out or sit down.  Best chinese in the city!
author: Emily T.

description: Average to sub-par standard chinese takeout.  They have brown rice, which is a big plus.  They put celery in the Kung Pao, which is just stupid.  Quick.  Not too expensive, but not particularly cheap either.  I've had some trouble with them not answering their phone during busy times.
author: Steven H.

description: i love this place. i guess i only know about it because i live in the same building, but i'm glad it's there. i try to get a lunch special every sunday, to eat while i watch a flick on hulu or an episode of dallas. the people who work there are friendly and the food (non-meat) is better than average. i have no complaints.
author: vincent m.

description: This place is so well hidden I'm surprised people even now about it. First of all, I work in the area and decided to try this place a long time ago. Ever since then it has been true what some of you Yelpers have said about the lady being rude here, but after going so often with my co-worker, she has lightend up a whole lot, LOL. Anyways, this is a good lunch spot if you are craving some decent chinese food for a really good price. ( Only been here during lunch ).
author: Sleep E.

description: I reccomend the honey walnut prawns and the veggie chowmein....sooooo  good. but beware lots of their dishes (mostly the chicken ones) have way too much breading.
author: Natasha v.

description: This was the worst chinese I have had.  It turns out that the only tihng worse than bad flavor is no flavor.  The Hot and Sour soup was literally not spicy, hot, nor sour, it was just cornstarch.  The mu shu pork tasted like it had been boiled to remove flavor.  This place is a block away and I will never go back
author: Noah H.
